headline: For FMCG Inc., the holy grail of volume growth is in sight
intro: FMCG companies are shifting focus from price hikes to volume-driven growth due to falling input costs, particularly palm oil. Recent customs duty reductions on edible oils are anticipated to improve profit margins and encourage investment in consumer promotions.
imagecaption: Despite selective price hikes by most FMCG companies in recent quarters, these haven't fully offset cost inflation in categories like dairy, beverages, and confectionery.

headline: Maggi crisis to capex boom: Narayanan's decade at Nestl� India
intro: Nestl� India?s capex has risen from 1.8% of sales in 2015 to 10% of sales in the year ended March 2025 as the company ramped up its portfolio after the Maggi crisis.
imagecaption: Suresh Narayanan, outgoing chairman and managing director, Nestl� India.

headline: Early monsoon showers dampen demand for cooling appliances
intro: Early monsoon and erratic weather slash sales of cooling products like ACs, ice creams, and beverages, leaving manufacturers grappling with high inventory and slower growth.
imagecaption: Unseasonal rains and early monsoon have disrupted summer sales across ACs, ice creams, and beverages. (Image: AFP)

headline: HUL confident of growth in FY26 amid improving demand, lower prices
intro: Hindustan Unilever anticipates monetary stimulus, lower inflation, and agricultural growth to drive growth in FY26. The company reported a turnover exceeding  ?60,000 crore for FY25 and a 5% rise in profit.
imagecaption: HUL boasts a portfolio of more than 50 brands spanning 15 categories, including packaged foods, home care, and personal care. (Mint)

headline: British American Tobacco Offloads $1.5 Billion Stake In ITC Via Block Deal | Share Crashes 4%
intro: British American Tobacco (BAT) offloaded a $1.5 billion (approximately  ?12,926 crore) stake in ITC Ltd on Wednesday through a block deal, slightly more than what it had originally planned, according to a term sheet reviewed by Mint. On Tuesday, BAT had announced plans to sell a 2.3% stake in ITC by offloading 290 million shares, valued at about $1.36 billion.
imagecaption: British American Tobacco Offloads $1.5 Billion Stake In ITC Via Block Deal

headline: Sensex today tumbles 240 points, Nifty slips below 24,800 in choppy trade; ITC top loser
intro: Nifty 50 finished the session with a drop of 63 points, or 0.3%, to settle at 24,752, while the Sensex declined 240 points, or 0.29%, to end the day at 81,312. The broader markets managed to buck the trend, as the Nifty Smallcap 100 index gained 0.33%, while the Nifty Midcap 100 index closed flat.
imagecaption: Sensex today tumbles 240 points, Nifty slips below 24,800 in choppy trade; ITC top loser
